New Zealand Herald https://www.nzherald.co.nz New Zealand Herald News Feed 2024 年 6 月 5 日，星期三 06:09:44 +0000 zh 1每小时1
Couple jointly charged with making meth at large clan lab near Tauranga https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Couple-jointly-charged-with-making-meth-at-large-clandestine-lab-near-tauranga/MA5MRXK4LRESNLHA3MNHAOKHWI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/ Couple-jointly-charged-with-making-meth-at-large-clandestine-lab-near-tauranga/MA5MRXK4LRESNLHA3MNHAOKHWI/ Hannah BartlettA man and woman are on trial for their alleged involvement in a large meth lab. Wed, 05 Jun 2024 06:00:00 +0000 The couple are jointly face six charges related to the production and manufacture of methamphetamine, and possession of cannabis for sale.
Catholic Cardinal John Dew allowed to resume public activities after sexual abuse allegations dismissed in Vatican review https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/catholic-cardinal-john-dew-allowed-to-resume-public-activities-after- Sex-abuse-allegations-dismissed-in-vatican-review/VK65YDFDXRHJNKZMUMHS7SYGUI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/catholic-cardinal-john-dew-allowed-to-resume-public-activities-after- Sex-abuse-allegations-dismissed-in-vatican-review/VK65YDFDXRHJNKZMUMHS7SYGUI/ Benjamin PlummerThe allegations dated back to the 1970s. Wed, 05 Jun 2024 05:46:34 +0000 Cardinal John Dew strenuously denied the allegations. Photo / Mark Mitchell
Shoppers claim they heard ‘porn like’ soft moaning over Kmart speakers in Tauranga https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/shoppers-claim-they-heard-porn-like-soft-moaning-over-kmart-speakers-in-tauranga/FS3SXYHLVZF7TPNFNINVWEVEIQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/bay-of-plenty-times/news/shoppers-claim-they-heard-porn-like-soft-moaning-over-kmart-speakers-in-tauranga/FS3SXYHLVZF7TPNFNINVWEVEIQ/ Carmen Hall"Sounded like, legit, a girl having a good time.” Wed, 05 Jun 2024 05:32:41 +0000 Shoppers at the Bethlehem Kmart in Tauranga claim they heard "soft moaning" porn sounds coming from the store's speaker system. Photo / John Borren
Government wants feedback from businesses on changes to the Holidays Acthttps://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/government-announces-proposed-changes-to-the-holiday-act/TRLWJTJSTJETZCP5J7HYYQOTKI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/kahu/government-announces-proposed-changes-to-the-holiday-act/TRLWJTJSTJETZCP5J7HYYQOTKI/ Brooke van Velden releases a draft of new Holidays Bill Wed, 05 Jun 2024 05:26:51 +0000 Workplace Relations Minister Brooke van Velden
Waitaanga homicide investigation: Police find van as they probe fatal shooting of father of four https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waitaanga-homicide-investigation-police-find-van-as-they-probe-fatal-shooting-of-father-of-four/PWM753UL4RD4HCURWLXXPIMFQI/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/waitaanga-homicide-investigation-police-find-van-as-they-probe-fatal-shooting-of-father-of-four/PWM753UL4RD4HCURWLXXPIMFQI/ A Waitaanga home was extensively damaged, with a body later found at the scene. Wed, 05 Jun 2024 05:25:03 +0000 Police investigating the homicide are interested in sightings of a late-model black LDV van that was seen in the area around the time of the incident. Photo / NZ Police

Photo / Michael Craig

Budget 2024: Number of frontline police on way from funding boost an illusion – Police Association https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/budget-2024-number-of-frontline-police-on-way-from-funding-boost-an-illusion-police-association/45MFRQAMZBEHRBYA6W6LJRRCLU/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/budget-2024-number-of-frontline-police-on-way-from-funding-boost-an-illusion-police-association/45MFRQAMZBEHRBYA6W6LJRRCLU/ The funding for 500 new cops will actually result in only 300, the association says.
